website_summaries.verdict: If money is no object and you want the very best, feature-packed model, this is it.
pros: Has an upgraded camera that increases video frame count and captures burst photos
Remote sports an improved video feed
cons: More features than the Phantom 4 Pro, at a price

customer_reviews.title: The future is here.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I won't go on and on about it, because there are a million reviews. The only thing I'll say is that if I had it to do over, I probably wouldn't get the controller with the display built in, because it's just a cheap android device. Definitely recommend getting the multi battery charger and getting at least one extra battery. (I bought a second battery after my first day with it).
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: DONT...  JUST DONT!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very expensive pain in the azz! After you get it it takes numerous days to update firmware and it doesn't come with a user manual which is fine; went online for that. After days of updates the video doesn't work! Learned the hard way that you can't use high grade micro sd card and once you put a micro sd card in the remote its permanent! :(. There is NO VIDEO support available currently so this $2,499.99 paper weight was a tremendous waste of time and money. I regret this purchase! Save your money!!!! I wish I could get mine back.
customer_reviews.author: Randal J Hodur

customer_reviews.title: What to know before you buy a basic or a Pro or Pro +
customer_reviews.text: If buying a Phantom, do not waste dollars on the Basic, It is riddled with firmware issues, updates daily, and god-forbid if you miss an update or are out of range, it will say updated. This Pro and Pro+ version I have put 3+ miles on without incident. Refresh still recommended (the only warranty In recommend strongly)
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Rimbold

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! The 4k video is quite impressive. It does take several hours of semi-frustration to get the hang of flying it. But now I love it and can't wait for each opportunity I get to fly it. It shoots such smooth video while moving. Initially I was worried it might be shaky or choppy motion but it is SMOOTH when it flies. One reviewer almost scared me away saying it's not professional video camera, but I think all enthusiasts will be pleasantly surprised with the quality and it's just professional photographers who will be nit-picky. Battery life really is like 20 minutes. Had to buy a bunch of spares.

customer_reviews.title: No Pre-Flight Planning, Firmware Issues
customer_reviews.text: If you buy the Pro+ version with the screen built in to the controller, you cannot get any apps for pre-flight planning. I do not mean waypoints, I mean the ability to pre-plan the route from a computer and import/export the route using a .kml file or similar. If you are planning to use this for aerial survey, or need to submit the files to a client, just get the controller without the screen. There are firmware issues with this controller and you absolutely need to make sure all updates (download from DJI's website) are completed first.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Totally Useless Junk Thanks To DJI Not Supporting Their Own Hardware
customer_reviews.text: There is no point in buying this unit for any reason. Sure, the display LOOKS great, but the problem is that it is an entirely closed system unlike a regular Android device. DJI has not, and refuses to, support their hardware with updates of the DJI Go 4 app on this device. This drone is completely hobbled by the fact that it cannot have any apps installed or updated on it, and the firmware is several years out of date. DJI gave up on the support for this drone as soon as they released it. They moved on and left the owners of this very expensive paper weight high and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L. King

customer_reviews.title: This is the second 4 Pro+ for me. The ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second 4 Pro+ for me. The first one had no connection between the controller and the aircraft. This one still has some issues, I am having freezing, lagging, and even blank screens when filming video in 4k. I realize that this is first generation technology but the issue has been known for over a month now and the manufacturer DJI has yet to resolve the problem. To be honest I have a Typhoon 4 pro and I am enjoying it much more than this aircraft.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Meyers

customer_reviews.title: First drone

Definitely like the bright screen and clean look of the pro+ controller.

customer_reviews.title: extended warranty offered by DJI has a time limit to purchase
customer_reviews.text: This product is everything that I expected. I recommend it very highly. One thing is that the extended warranty offered by DJI has a time limit to purchase. If you wish you purchase it, you have a limited amount of time from product registration to add this coverage. DJI allows you to purchase it later but the process is complicated so its best to make your decision before you register and fly the drone for the first time.....
customer_reviews.author: Bob Raub

customer_reviews.title: An amazing drone
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic drone. By far the best drone that I've ever owned. Pros: Amazing image quality for stills and video. Great low light performance. Easy to operate and difficult to crash. Very steady hover. The collision avoidance sensors make flying in tight spaces much safer. Flight time has been close to the advertised 30 minutes. Cons: The downloadable maps are only for mainland China. Nothing for the USA or Europe. Some of the software has prompts in Chinese and could be more user friendly. The transmission system is not as robust as with the Mavic. Typically getting some signal drop out at 0.6 to 1 mile.

customer_reviews.title: I would give this 10 stars if it would just ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 10 stars if it would just get half of the range DJI specs it out at. As it sits I can fly about 2000' before losing signal and let me tell you the first time that happened my f@%&$#g heart stopped. The fail safes took over and it came home on its own as advertised. This thing can practically fly itself. It comes with everything you need to get started. All that is needed is a charge of the batteries and an update of all the firmware. You should be flying in an hour. It'll take you that long to register with the FAA ($5), update the firmware, and look over the manual and controller.

The screen is bright but for the extra money, you are better off just buying a cheap tablet, because at least you can detach it from the drone remote and surf the web or watch movies etc.....

customer_reviews.title: The Phantom 4 pro+ is a awesome machine! The video is a major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The Phantom 4 pro+ is a awesome machine! The video is a major disappointment! Both 2.4 and 5.8 GHZ. video transmission are flawed, the video is unusable! Instead of recording the video from the camera directly to the SD Card, it transmits the broken image and records it, therefore ruining any chance of getting quality video. Someone didn't think this one through. I get better video from a $50 knock off Go-Pro than this set-up! I'd really like to talk to the manufacture and see why they set it up this way?
